sentences.sContent: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.sCn: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.sContent: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.sCn: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

sentences.sContent: ...And because those influence educational success and later earnings...
...Changes in policy would be approved or rejected as a whole so that lobbyists would find it hard to influence lawmakers...
...In 1920s，it underwent some changes due to the influence of western dress...
...They have moderated its influence on their personal lives...
...But an array of countries are rushing to assert greater influence here...
...Many countries are racing against each other to increase their business and strategic influence on Antarctica...
...But they also acknowledge that concerns about “resource security” influence their moves...
...So great is the influence of online ratings that many companies now hire digital reputation managers to ensure a favorable online identity...
...from being concerned exclusively about individual patients to exerting influence on how healthcare dollars are spent...

synos.tran: 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事

phrases.pCn: n. 影响因素；电话干扰系数
不利影响；消极作用；负影响
n. 不正当影响；[律]不正当压力
外部影响；外来因素；外界影响

trans.tranOther: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want
